result.execSummary:
The defendant Carmelo H. Rosado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carmelo H. Rosado is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carmelo H. Rosado was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Carmelo H. Rosado was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Shall not use or possess controlled substances without a legal prescription therefor;  Shall not use or possess drug paraphernalia

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: Sentence shall commence on or before Court ordered start date; with work release and transfer privileges

records.addlTxt:
13CF366 & 14CF225 - Defendant Carmelo H. Rosado in court with attorney Alexander Stormont.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Discussion regarding sentencing recomendations.  Court heard and imposes sentence as follows:

13CF366:

Sentence w/held
3 yrs probation conc. to 14CF225
180 days DCJ - 60 days comm. 9/29/14 and 120 days imposed & stayed w/h&t
Maintain absolute sobriety
No controlled substance w/o valid pres.
State has 60 days to request restitution of buy money
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge
Court costs
Any counseling determined by agent

14CF225:

Sentence w/held
2 yrs probation conc. to 13CF366
15 days DCJ comm. 9/29/14 - COUNT 2 ONLY
No additional jail time on ct 4
Maintain absolute sobriety
No controlled substance w/o valid pres.
Pay court costs
Any counseling determined by agent

Two cases called - 13CF366, 14CF225.  Defendant Carmelo H. Rosado in court with attorney Alexander Stormont.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Stormont is heard, he and his client have reached resolution with State on both cases.  Atty. Klomberg is heard, will Move to dismiss count 1 on case 14CF225 outright.  Stipulation recited.  Court reviews charges/penalties, PQWOR with Defendant.  Count 1 in case 14CF225 is dismissed, preliminary hearing is removed.  On case 13CF366, count 2 - DE pleads NC.  On case 14CF225 - DE pleads NC to Counts 2 and 4.  Court finds pleas made FVKI, accepts pleas and finds guilty of those three counts.   Counts 1 and 3 on case 13CF366 and Count 3 on Case 14CF255 are DRI. Court schedules sentencing hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 12:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on July 30, 2014 at 12:30 pm.

12:54 - Intern Holdahl appears for State. Def IC VV w/Atty Ben Szilagyi from Winnebago Cty SPD (eligible).   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets bond at $1000 PA bond  with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.
